item.title: Dead Fox, 28th June
item.description:
I found a dead fox in my garden, 42 Gregory Crescent

item.title: Broken slabs and uneven pavement along the street near Russell Park entrance, 28th June
item.description:
These pavement slabs have been broken for some time. They are all along the entrance to Russell Park on Woolwich Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household furniture dumped blocking pavement!!, 28th June
item.description:
When I woke up this morning there was a washing machine and chair dumped outside my house people have added to the rubbish today there is now 2 cardboard boxes on the chair.it is down the bottom of kemsing road se10 0ll these items are causing people to walk in the road could cause an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Kemsing Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water seeping from station, 28th June
item.description:
This foul smelling water regularly appears on the road outside. It comes from the bank of the railway line and collects in the drain as it moves across the road. The drains is blocked so often the road floods. Can you please unblock the drain and investigate where the water is coming from. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lemmon Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: NW6 6jh. Front of Argos, 28th June
item.description:
Sorry. People front of Argos they feeding the birds every day make in the street very dirty and small very bad can you do something about this people they very dangerous human I want to make report about this people they are killing people for doing feeding birds is very bad smell they are making

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn Square, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping near bins behind bus station, 28th June
item.description:
Someone has dumped a bunch of trash here. Flytipping is an ongoing problem on this area most likely due to the bins belonging to the shops nearby which encourage people to just dump their things as well.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Forest Hill Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unfilled hole where tree used to be, 28th June
item.description:
There used to be a tree in this hole in pearson‘s park. But it’s been dead and removed for over a year now. The hole is a trip hazard and is collecting rubbish. It should be filled in and grass seeded.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Patina Walk, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small sinkhole by the manhole cover, 28th June
item.description:
Sink hole appeared when the tarmac melted in 20th June. It’s got bigger since then. It’s a trip hazard, particularly for our sight impaired neighbour who uses a white cane for navigation. Please can it be repaired asap. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Lemmon Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rusted, broken, 28th June
item.description:
The issue is with the teenagers at the moment they are using the fence similar to a volleyball net and they're climbing on it and it's too old and unstable to take their weight. Several of the upright struts have rusted and rotted through with the weight of them climbing over. The whole fence is now starting to buckle. This is located in Stevens Park straight behind St Michael's School.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wrotham Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in alley way, 28th June
item.description:
I reported this flytipping on 5th June. The rubbish is still there and has been added to so there is now a mattress, fridge, pipes, empty paint cans, bags of rubbish and a Christmas tree. This alleyway is used by many children on their way to and from school. It is not a safe environment for them to walk through with all this rubbish dumped.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Sandy Hill Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MOT expired in April, 28th June
item.description:
This car has been parked in Oakways for a number of months with no MOT. It is not being used and is just sat there. Can this be removed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97-105, Oakways, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No through road/dead end, 28th June
item.description:
There is no sign at the beginning of Bedford Court off Bedfordbury indicating that it is a no-through road/dead end. Consequently, cars are constantly turning into it believing it is a way through to other parts of Covent Garden, causing them to u turn and cause further congestion when trying to exit Bedfordbury
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Bedfordbury, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Glass in Play area, 28th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandway Road, Poverest, London
